content.rendered:
Welcome to our Springvale FC page.  Here we will give you our latest news on results, fixtures and star players!

We are passionate about coaching football for all ages, all abilities and both boys and girls.

We have lots of teams to cover all ages and abilities as we believe that sport should be accessible to all. We also want to encourage our best to play to progress a high standard through competitive action and quality coaching.  Most importantly; sport should be fun so we will always ensure that the children play as a team and with a smile on their face!

#Playtogether

#UptheVale

See the bottom of this page for stats, results and match reports!

 

Fixtures:

Y5/6 Girls at Kingsoak (Wombwell)

To be rearranged

 

We will be organising lots of fixtures from February to July 2020 for all teams!

 

Recent Results:

Y5/6 home to Burton Road (friendly) 7-3 defeat

Y5/6 boys second at local finals (2-1 defeat in the final to PSJ)

Y5/6 girls beat Churchfield 1-0 (H)

Y3/4 girls drew 1-1 with Churchfield (H)

Y4 beat Y3 4-0 in an intra-school game

Y3/4 finished 5th in a local qualification event

 

Report:

Friday 27th September 2019

Springvale played Burton Road at home.

1st Game of the season 2019/20

What a start to the game, with an absolute banger goal from Yr 6 Noah Town, Assisted by Alex ‘’Leggy ‘’cash with a cracking cross from the Left wing.

Burton Road came back with fire in their bellies with an astonishing top left corner goal, leaving the Vale wanting more.

Burton Road fought like lions in the first half, with another Smashing goal by their number 10, followed by a further 3 goals by a superb team.

The vale continued to defend hard, with Liam.D saving 7 (attempted) goals in total throughout the match.

When out of nowhere was the speed of Cashy (Y6) he skipped down the right wing with skill and pace and finished it with a smash into the bottom right corner of the net …..WHAT A GOAL!

Burton Road continued to play with strength, following another 3 goals.

A cracking goal from Finlay Bowe made the final score 7-3 to Burton Road.

Springvale had a great team from the keeper right through to the attackers along with a great team spirit…amazing to watch.

 

Well done

UP THE VALE

 

Charlie Baumber Year 6

 

Current Star Players:

Y6- George B

Y5- Seth P

Y4- Ted, Patrick

Y3- Josie

Y2- Mason

 

Coaches:

Mr L Crossfield (1st Team)

Mr L McClure (Development Teams)

Mrs E Stead (Girls’ Team)

Mrs H Burton (Girls’ Team)

Mr T Venus (Goalkeeper Coach)

 

Top Scorers (All fixtures)

Keira Leigh F (Y6) 6

Noah T (Y6) 5

Finlay B (Y5) 3

Alex C (Y6) 1

Jess B (Y4) 1

Harry S (Y4) 1

 

Tournament Record:

Y3/4 girls- 2nd at regional event

Y3/4 boys- 5th at regional event

Y5/6 girls- 3rd at regional event

Y5/6 boys- 2nd at regional event

jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Welcome to our page for the Parent Council! jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Our Reading leaders are Mrs R Fearn and Mrs D Royston. Please ask them for more information or support where needed.
